events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection on April 30th.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the provided incident details and keywords.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the vehicle collision claim to ensure timely processing.
The insured was notified that their auto accident claim has been officially received and is under review.
The insurance company requested photos of the damaged vehicle and the police report for further assessment.
The insured submitted all requested documentation including detailed photos, the accident report, and repair estimates.
The claims department began their investigation into the reported auto accident and damages to the vehicle.
Investigation concluded confirming the vehicle damage was consistent with the collision described by the insured.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs and other related expenses for the vehicle accident.
The insured reviewed the settlement proposal and responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the offer.
The claim was formally approved by the claims manager after agreement on settlement terms was reached.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued to the insured to cover the vehicle damages from the accident.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following successful payment and confirmation of repair completion.
The completed and closed auto accident claim was archived securely in the company records for future reference.
